CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A low band - gap copolymer consisting of 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene ( TA ) as an electron - donating unit and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) as an electron - withdrawing unit has been synthesized and applied to the donor material in polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA)
2. diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP)

Both TA and DPP are material names in this paragraph. They are identified as the specific types of copolymers used in the synthesis of the low band-gap copolymer for use as a donor material in polymer solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA)
2. diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to specific material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A low band - gap copolymer consisting of 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene ( TA ) as an electron - donating unit and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) as an electron - withdrawing unit has been synthesized and applied to the donor material in polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. A low band-gap copolymer: This is a type of polymer, specifically a copolymer, with a low energy band gap. The band gap is a property that describes the energy required to promote an electron from the valence band to the conduction band in a material.
2. 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA): This is a specific type of organic compound, an anthracene with 9,10-thienyl substituents. Thienyl is a substituent, and it is a five-membered ring aromatic heterocycle with a sulfur atom. The property values related to this compound could be its molecular weight, melting point, boiling point, etc.
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP): This is another specific organic compound, a diketopyrrolopyrrole. It is an electron-withdrawing unit, meaning it can withdraw electrons from other molecules. The property values related to this compound could be its molecular weight, melting point, boiling point, etc.
4. Electron-donating unit: This is a property of the 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA) compound, as it is described as an electron-donating unit in the context of the copolymer.
5. Electron-withdrawing unit: This is a property of the diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP) compound, as it is described as an electron-withdrawing unit in the context of the copolymer.
6. Donor material: This is a property of the copolymer as a whole, as it is described as the material used as the donor in polymer solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. A low band-gap copolymer: band gap (energy)
2. 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA): molecular weight, melting point, boiling point
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP): molecular weight, melting point, boiling point
4. Donor material: N/A (The paragraph does not provide any specific property value for the donor material as a whole.)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| band gap (energy) |
| 9,10-thienyl-substituted anthracene (TA) |
| molecular weight |

| boiling point |
